result.execSummary:
Phillip L. Ford was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Phillip L. Ford was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip L. Ford

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk :PT
Atty Hertz-McGrath acknowledges receipt of fugitive complaint; DE waives extradition and elects to return to Illinois and signs waiver of extradition.  Court grants extradition and signs order.
Extradition hearing on April 2, 2015 at 08:50 am.
Due to a continued jury trial; hearing rescheduled to 4/2/15 at 8:50 AM and confirmed with Atty Hertz-McGrath's Office.

132pm  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk: LE  Referred to Br.8 for further disposition on 3/10/15 @ 830am (extradition waiver hrg).  Deft wishes to waive extradition.  Bond continued.  kmk

152 p.m.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Initial appearance adjourned to 3/3/15 @ 1:00pm  - Intake court, 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI.  Atty Status:  D Hertz-McGrath.  Time limits tolled. Temporary  $7500 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
